result.execSummary:
The defendant Perry J. Henke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Fail/Comply-Officer/Person into Custody, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.415(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Follow standard rules of probation
AODA assessment and follow through with all treatment
Absolute sobriety
No possession of alcohol

timeConds.notes: to be completed within first year

miscConds.notes:
See count 1

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Perry J. Henke in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 9:36 am  Presentence report has been filed and reviewed.  No amendments or corrections to PSI.  Victim rights have been complied with.  State presents sentencing arguments.  Requesting probation for 2 yrs on each count. AODA and counseling with follow through. Absolute sobriety.  Community service 100 hrs.  No conditional jail time requested.  Atty Seifert presents sentencing arguments.  Agree with recommendation of State.  Nothing by def.  Sentencing remarks by the court. Court will accept agreement.  Court orders sentence withheld, probation  2yrs.  Follow standard rules of probation.  AODA assessment and follow through with all treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  No possession of alcohol.  100 hrs community service with in 1st yr.  Court cost and DNA surcharge and sample.  Credit of 22 days if revoked.  Felony convictions rights reviewed.  Post conviction rights Sentence on all counts.  Court cost on each, only 1 DNA surcharge.  Bond to cost and balance to poster
Sentencing hearing on September 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Perry J. Henke in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Def is eligible for public defender, however counsel has not been appointed.  Def has complied with orders of court.   Court instructs def to call public defender office as least once a week.  Bond will continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Perry J. Henke in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 8:41 am  Court questions def in regards to being represented by counsel.  Court reviews right to an atty.  Def was previously represented by counsel.  Statement by def.  Further review by Court for counsel.  Def is requesting counsel.  Court will continue this matter.  Court questions def in regards to assets.  Def provided public defenders address and phone number.  Off Record.  Back on record  Matter adjourned.  Individual in court room request to make statement.  Court addresses.  Bond will continue.  Def to contact the public defenders office today.  Recess 8:58 am  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel
Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Perry J. Henke in court with attorney John B. Rhode.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 11:42 a.m. Plea agreemen tstated - Plea to cts 1, 4, & 5. Cts 2 & 3 will be dismissed. Joint recommendation for PSI. State will agree to ask for no more than 6 yrs prison - 3 yrs initial, 3 yrs ext supv. on ct 4 with remaining cts being concurrent. Atty Rhode and Def agree. Court reviews background on NGI plea and competency evaluation. Atty Rhode explains. Court reviews with Defendant. Defendant wishes to proceed. Statement by ADA Laufenberg.  Ct 1 charge and penalties reviewed. Guilty plea. Ct 4 charge and penalties reviewed. Guilty plea. Ct 5 charge and penalties reviewed. Guilty plea. Court reviews plea quest. and constitutional rights. Court reviews firearms and voting restrictions and DNA surcharge. Statement by Atty Rhode. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely entered. Court accepts pleas. Stipulate factual basis. Court finds guilty of cts 1, 4 & 5. Cts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in pursuant to agreement. PSI ordered. Court advises felony conviction. Bond continues.

Defendant Perry J. Henke in court with attorney John B. Rhode.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:00 a.m. Statement by Atty Rhode, asks jury trial be set. Discussion regarding experts. Thirty days notice will be given by defense regarding experts. Def reminded of bond conditions.  Jury trial scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Perry J. Henke in court with attorney John B. Rhode.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 10:54 am  Competency hearing.  Report has been filed.  Def is competent.  Statement by Atty. Rhode.  Counsel is working on obtaining expert testimony in regards to plea entered by def.  Response by Atty Uttke.  Additional statement by Atty Rhode. Court reviews statue.  State is requesting court appoint.  Court will appoint Dr. Galli for mental defect, mental disease evaluation.  Bond will continue  Hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
For Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

Defendant Perry J. Henke in court with attorney John B. Rhode.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls @ 1:50 pm.   Atty Rhode files a written waiver of p.h.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause. Information Filed.  Atty Rhode has copy of information, waives reading & enters Not Guilty by mental disease defect plea to all 5 ct's & explains. State suggest that court inform evaluation.  Atty Rhode quotes state 971.16.  Court questions plea. Atty Rhode explains. State gives recommendation.  Court will order competency evaluation to Dr. Galli. Def. phone number 715-216-3893. Court accepts NGI plea to all ct's.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Perry J. Henke not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls @ 1:58 pm.  State moves to lift no contact provision with D.H. Court will lift & set aside no contact provision with D.H., No new bond needed.

ADDRESS INFO for Perry J. Henke
Current: W6382 Hwy 64, Bryant, WI 54418 United States  (Effective: 07-01-2014)
Prior: W8911 Cth W, Antigo, WI 54409
No contact with D. H. Court will allow def.to  remove items needed for work with Law enforcement present.    No use of alcohol, absolute sobriety

Defendant Perry J. Henke in court via video with attorney John B Rhode.  Defendant Perry J. Henke in custody.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Amended complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Special appearance and reserve jurisdictional objections.  Review of bond, arguments presented by Atty Rhode.  Response by DA for bond.  Additional arguments by counsel.  Bond reduced by court with conditions.  Time limits for preliminary waived  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Perry J. Henke in court, via video, in custody.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA has discussed this Atty Schuster.  Matter adjourned.  Def to complete documents for the public defender.  Bond will continue.  Def request signature bond.  Court reviews bond with defendant.  Bond may be reviewed on 6-30-14.  Bond will continue  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jessica L Schuster in court.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Schuster.  Court will adjourn  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
